# program to find second largest and second smallest in an array

```
package practice;

public class SecondLargestandSmallestNumbersInArray {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		int[] a= {12,3,90,34,54,2,4,90,89};
		
//		Logic 1
		
//		int max1=0;
//		int max2=0;
//		if(a[0]>a[1]) {
//			max1=a[0];
//			max2=a[1];
//		}
//		else {
//			max1=a[1];
//			max2=a[0];
//		}
//		for(int i=2;i<a.length;i++) {
//			if(a[i]>max1) {
//				max2=max1;
//				max1=a[i];
//			}
//			else if(a[i]>max2){
//				max2=a[i];
//			}
//				
//			}
//		
//System.out.println("second largest is" + max2);
		
//		Logic2 it will ignore duplicates. by using integer wrapper class
		int largest= Integer.MIN_VALUE;
		int secondLargest = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
		
		for(int num:a) {
			if(num>largest) {
				secondLargest=largest;
				largest=num;
			}
			else if(num>secondLargest && num!=largest){
				secondLargest = num;
			}
			
		}
		System.out.println("second largest is" + secondLargest);

		
//		secondsmallest 
		int smallest = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
		int secondSmallest = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
		
		for(int num:a) {
			if(num<smallest) {
				secondSmallest =smallest;
				smallest = num;
			}
			else if(num<secondSmallest &&  num!=smallest) {
				secondSmallest=num;
			}
		}
System.out.println("second smallest is "+ secondSmallest);
	}
	

}
```

### output:

second largest is89

second smallest is 3
